sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词含有"黎明，黄昏"之意。
means: twilight ： 指日落后或日出前的微明，但通常侧重于前者。
dawn ： 指天刚亮时的黎明，可作引申用。
dusk ： 指接近夜晚的黄昏时刻。

sentence.Network_en: At dawn I woke him up and said we were leaving.
sentence.Network_cn: 黎明时分，我把他叫醒，告诉他我们要走了。

sentence.Network_en: I started work at dawn and returned only at nightfall.
A breakfast will be served to those who last out till dawn!
sentence.Network_cn: 坚持到天亮的能吃上早餐！

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 15th cent. (as a verb): back-formation from Middle English dawning

entry.def: Dawn is the time of day when light first appears in the sky, just before the sun rises.
The dawn of a period of time or a situation is the beginning of it.

example.ex: We can only guess what went through the mind of a man who could look back to the dawn of powered flight.
example.tran: 一个能够回想起动力飞行初始阶段的人那时脑子里想了些什么，我们只能够猜测而已。

entry.def: If something is dawning, it is beginning to develop or come into existence.

example.ex: Throughout Europe a new railway age, that of the high-speed train, has dawned...
example.tran: 新的铁路时代——高速铁路时代，在整个欧洲已经开始出现。

example.ex: A new era seemed to be about to dawn for the coach and his young team...
example.tran: 对于那名教练和他的年轻球队来说，一个崭新的时代似乎即将到来。

entry.def: When you say that a particular day dawned, you mean it arrived or began, usually when it became light.

example.ex: When the great day dawned, the first concern was the weather...
example.tran: 当那个不同寻常的日子到来时，大家首先关注的是天气。

example.ex: The next day dawned sombre and gloomy.
example.tran: 第二天拂晓时，天色阴沉昏暗。

sentences.sentence: "it was the dawn of the Roman Empire"

means.word_mean: 1. become clear or enter one's consciousness or emotions;

sentences.sentence: "It dawned on him that she had betrayed him"
"It started to dawn, and we had to get up"

Sentence.sentence: It was terrible at first, especially getting up before dawn to catch that 6:30 train.
We went through a dramatic shift," says Dawn Watkins, the vice president for student affairs.

They had titles like Young vs Old, Gray Dawn and The Coming Generational Storm, and their message was blunt: health-care systems were heading for the rocks, pensioners were taking young people to the cleaners, and soon there would be intergenerational warfare.

sentences.en: The dawns here in the mountains are very beautiful.
sentences.cn: 这里山区的黎明是很美的。

sentences.en: Did you hear the cock crow at dawn?
sentences.cn: 黎明时你听到鸡叫了吗?

sentences.en: At dawn we broke through the barbed wire entanglements under the city wall.
sentences.cn: 拂晓我们突破了城墙的铁丝网。

sentences.en: They got across the bridge before dawn.
sentences.cn: 他们于破晓前过了那座桥。

sentences.en: They work from dawn till dark.
sentences.cn: 他们从天亮一直工作到天黑。

sentences.en: The war was ended and we looked forward to the dawn of much happier days.
sentences.cn: 大战结束了, 我们盼望着更加美好的日子的来临。

sentences.en: The day was dawning when we set out.
They were waiting for the day to dawn.
Last Sunday dawned a perfect day.
sentences.cn: 上星期日, 一早就是个好天气。

sentences.en: The morning dawned fresh and clear after the storm at night.
sentences.cn: 夜里暴风雨过后, 拂晓清新而晴朗。

sentences.en: After the storm at night, the morning dawned clear and fine over the bay.
sentences.cn: 经过一夜的暴风雨之后, 海湾的早晨分外晴朗。

sentences.en: The next day dawned bright and sunny.
sentences.cn: 第二天一大早阳光灿烂。

sentences.en: The space age dawned in the twentieth century.
sentences.cn: 太空时代开始于二十世纪。

sentences.en: A new age dawned with the invention of the radio.
sentences.cn: 随着无线电的发明, 一个新时代开始了。

jushi.chinese: 拂晓我们突破了城墙的铁丝网。

jushi.english: The dawns here in the mountains are very beautiful.
jushi.chinese: 这里山区的黎明是很美的。

jushi.english: They work from dawn till dark.
